result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew P Stein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Straight Time. Sentence credit of 38 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Andrew P Stein in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1. Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:  

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

120 DAYS STRAIGHT TIME (CREDIT - 38 days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR      *Concurrent with Dane County case*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 


**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

COSTS:  $253.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Dated 11/12/15, from Atty Bricco to Judge Carter, requesting to set case for plea/sentencing hearing.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 12/01/15.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/Menards listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Andrew P Stein in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
